content.description: Content to store in the file, expected to be an UTF-8 encoded string.

content_base64.description: Content to store in the file, expected to be binary encoded as base64 string.

directory_permission.description: Permissions to set for directories created (in numeric notation).

file_permission.description: Permissions to set for the output file (in numeric notation).

filename.description:
The path to the file that will be created.
					Missing parent directories will be created.
					If the file already exists, it will be overridden with the given content.

sensitive_content.description: Sensitive content to store in the file, expected to be an UTF-8 encoded string.

source.description: Path to file to use as source for the one we are creating.

block.description: Generates a local file with the given content.

content.description: Sensitive content to store in the file, expected to be an UTF-8 encoded string.

content_base64.description: Sensitive content to store in the file, expected to be binary encoded as base64 string.

directory_permission.description: Permissions to set for directories created (in numeric notation).

file_permission.description: Permissions to set for the output file (in numeric notation).

filename.description:
The path to the file that will be created.
					Missing parent directories will be created.
					If the file already exists, it will be overridden with the given content.

source.description: Path to file to use as source for the one we are creating.

block.description: Generates a local file with the given sensitive content.

content.description: Raw content of the file that was read, as UTF-8 encoded string.

content_base64.description: Base64 encoded version of the file content (use this when dealing with binary data).

filename.description: Path to the file that will be read. The data source will return an error if the file does not exist.

block.description: Reads a file from the local filesystem.

content.description: Raw content of the file that was read, as UTF-8 encoded string.

content_base64.description: Base64 encoded version of the file raw content (use this when dealing with binary data).

filename.description: Path to the file that will be read. The data source will return an error if the file does not exist.

block.description: Reads a file that contains sensitive data, from the local filesystem.
